explanation: The cast-to-void lines (e.g. (void) upload_data_size;) are no-op expressions at runtime, but they are an intentional idiom to mark parameters as unused and to suppress compiler diagnostics. MISRA Rule 2.2 forbids dead code — operations whose removal would not affect program behaviour — but the purpose of these casts is to affect build-time diagnostics/intent and to document that the parameter is intentionally unused. In practice MISRA guidance accepts explicit unused-parameter annotations (such as a (void)cast or a dedicated UNUSED macro) as the correct way to handle unused parameters. Therefore the claim that the single statement (void) upload_data_size; is a violation of MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2 is not correct.
